name: Esmeralda Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 8 nights the last week of January. We were given a room in a very quiet location a little further from than the beach than expected but the fact that is was secluded and quiet made up for it. The room itself was very clean and had a great shower/bath. The down side is that it could use more comfortable chairs on the deck and in the room. The fridge was not working but a maintenance man showed up 15 minutes later with a new one. Staff was very friendly. I would suggest renting a car during your stay to explore the island. The driving is very easy and there are some really nice beaches to visit (Friars Bay for one). Also Grand Case and Marigot are great towns to explore. Lolos in Grand Case to eat are a real bargain and good. The complimentary continental breakfast at the resort as mentioned in other reviews is pretty sparse. Toasted baguettes, yummy croissants and fruit. If you want any protein you can order eggs and bacon off the menu for a price. We did once and it was very good. All and all we had a great time. Beach chairs were easy to find. No problem with lack of chairs even in high season. Also, bungalows had individual swimming pools that were rarely being used which was an added plus.
reviews.title: Beautiful Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Esmeralda Resort for the last two weeks in July, travelled via Canjet with Air Transat Vacations. We had a lovely time, but the facilities could use some updating. The resort is advertised on Tripcentral as five-stars, but I would not rate the resort as more than four stars. This was our fourth trip to St-Martin's, but our first at this resort.
reviews.title: Great beach, lovely island, fabulous food, nice accommodations, but not spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS: We had a "deluxe" room which is the regular room but poolside and closer to the beach --- we were in second building from the beach which was great. No ocean view at all, however. The rooms are rather spartan (two beds, a small table and two chairs and a dresser), and could use a reading chair or something. The small kitchenette is very handy, all the basics, a two burner stovetop, but no microwave. Also the tv is pretty basic, about 20 or 26 inches and not even a flat screen. Channel selection was great. The air conditioner made a small whistling sound which was annoying, and I complained but they couldnt fix it, and said it was normal for the new air conditioners. We got used to it after a few days! Rooms were very clean and maid service was great. The best part is that each little bungalow of three to four rooms has a small pool right outside your patio door, which is not very used so it feels like your own private pool. Our room came with a continental breakfast in the restaurant, which included fruit, juice, coffee and toast and croissant. OK but they should add some protein like cheese, or have cereal and milk too. The rest is a la carte and quite expensive.
reviews.title: Ok but not spectacular

reviews.text: BEACH: Great beach! Quiet, lovely sand, with very nice beach chairs with comfy cushions on them. We tipped the beach guy every day and he made sure our chairs were set up and watched our things. It is very laid back, no blaring music. You can walk the beach for a couple of miles. Nice to swim in too. You can get bar service on the beach, but we had packed a folding cooler, and brought our "essentials" with us on the beach.
reviews.title: Excellent location and accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SIGHTSEEING AND RESTAURANTS: We rented a car for the two weeks we were there, because we love to tour the island. There are many other lovely beaches on the island and great scenery, shopping in Philippsburgh, sights to see in Marigot, casinos in Maho and at the Westin, a butterfly farm, lots to see!
reviews.title: A beautiful resort on the best beach in the Caribbean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed one night at this place and had a very large room with some sea view.
reviews.title: Overall a nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villas composed of 4 or 5 rooms, sharing a (small) swimming-pool, are scattered in a nice garden.
reviews.title: A fine option in St. Martin
Really Enjoyed
reviews.text: Orient Bay is just a few steps away. We enjoyed the Coco Beach restaurant for lunch, but did not try the main restaurant only open in the evening.
All in all a nice place, however rather overpriced. Room was nice but certainly not worth the official 400 USD price per night...
reviews.title: Great trip
A real gem with very little problems
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Esmerelda in Orient Bay. We booked through American Express and because of our ability to use points for a good portion of the trip, it's not really fair for me to comment on value. The location of the hotel is great, though, and seeing other options in Grand Case and Marigot, I would absolutely choose Orient Bay again. We felt safe there and really enjoyed being on Orient Beach. It wasn't overly crowded the week we were there (March 1-6) and the little "Village" with restaurants and convenience stores was nice to have nearby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Esmeralda from April 18 through the 23rd, 2010. This was our 2nd visit and we look forward to returning to Esmeralda again.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Esmeralda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • When we arrived, we were given a room upgrade to one with an ocean view, Room 457. The resort seemed quieter this year, maybe because our stay coincided with the volcanic ash cloud that was preventing flights from leaving much of Europe.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • The room was immaculate. We had a king size bed – as we requested, and we loved the walk-in shower and the air conditioning kept the room very comfortable. When we visit St. Martin, we always stop at a supermarket and load up on groceries. The kitchenette was very well equipped to allow for this, including an array of dishes and tableware. Not only does this cut down on expenses, but also we really don’t want to eat out for every meal. We are early risers and had breakfast on the private deck overlooking the bay every morning.
reviews.title: Another Great Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • The beach set-up at Esmeralda is better than others because it doesn’t see as many cruise ship and other day-trippers. The busses drop them off further down the beach, and that adds to the crowd and puts more pressure on chair availability in front of other resorts. Chairs and an umbrella are provided at no charge in front of the Coco Beach restaurant, which is right in front of the resort.
reviews.title: Beware, No Security

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • The resort landscaping is very well designed and maintained. The front desk was very helpful with local knowledge, and all the resort employees were exceptionally nice. Claudie Nannini, the manager, came out and said hello to us.
reviews.title: Disappointing and dumpy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed 3 nights here and would recommend this hotel. Rooms are configured villa-style: 4 rooms in one building, which has its own nice pool in backyard. Our "villa" seemed full, but you could have pool to yourself if wanted most of the time. Room was comfortable - good aircon, OK bed (huge since 2 double beds pushed together), old-fashioned TV (not flat-screen) but with many cable channels. Kitchenette included good mini-fridge. Did not use the 2-burner stove (looked old though). There was an old-looking toaster oven stowed in a cabinet. Surprised there was no microwave. Kitchen sink was odd as it was a bowl, bath-style sink. In bathroom and kitchen, tiny bugs constantly crawling all over the counters. Just tried to ignore this. Make sure you cover up personal toiletries and food. Hotel is about 5-minute walk (or less) to Orient Beach along nice path on hotel property. They don't want you to bring drinks to beach so they can sell more overpriced drinks there, which I understand, but it seems a little heavy-handed to dictate this to hotel guests. Continental breakfast included fresh fruit salad (OK), so-so fruit juice, and so-so coffee. Also toasted tartines (baguette) and couple of croissants. Could order few other items if desired for additional fee. Wanted to stay here to be close to good beach and Esmeralda delivers as Orient Beach is beautiful. Beach is mostly topless, so be aware of that if you have any issues. Watch your belongings on beach as some local guys tried to steal our sunglasses off beach table, but we caught them right away and they just handed them back. Doesn't make you feel safe when this is one of the best beaches on the island. We probably wouldn't go back to St. Martin/Maarten, but if we did, we would recommend staying at Esmeralda. Also, hotel is not in Marigot at all, as Trip Advisor indicates. Marigot, Grand Case and Orient Beach are 3 totally different places.
reviews.title: Nice stay close to great Orient Beach

reviews.title: our best trip we have been on
Use the safe!!!
reviews.text: My wife and I visited St Martin on our 10th anniversary and Esmeralda was recommended by friends. The Villas were cozy but not very elegant as other reviewers have said, but we enjoyed them. The private pool was very nice for natural swims any time of day. Our "neighbors" were all very nice and comfortable with nudity or topless which ever u choose. This is not a resort I would recommend to take children. The complimentary breakfast was light but satisfying and you could order "american" breakfast that also was good for an additional charge. We stayed in room 466 and it did have a view of the ocean from about 100 yards. Our room was very private as we were the last room on the property before you got to the ocean. Staying on Orient Beach is an "eye opening" affair at first, but once you see it you become comfortable with it pretty fast. The beach was beautiful and our beach boy, Thai, was very accomodating and kept our drinks from running out. The beach restaurants, including ours(Cocoa Beach), were very good for lunch. We especially liked Kontiki. For dinner we experienced several restaurants close by, L'Astrolabe(at the resort), La Plantation(just outside the resort), and I think it was called Paris, TX(at Orient Village). But my favorite was an Italian restaurant at Grand Case, IL Nettuno. Overall this was a fabulous vacation and we are already looking forward to our return trip in which we will again stay at Esmeralda!

description: ESMERALDA RESORT, situated on the magnificent white sands of Orient Bay in French St. Martin offers just 65 rooms and suites spread among elegant tropical gardens in 17 villas. Esmeralda is the only four star hotel in St Martin on Orient Beach.Esmeralda's Coco Beach Bar offers beachfront lunch & cocktails. L'Astrolabe, the resort's fine dining restaurant offers French Creole and Continental cuisine. Guests receive dining privileges at 12 + restaurants in Orient Bay. Only minutes to more fine dining,shopping and entertainment. Rooms include a kitchenette, king bed, sitting area and patio. What makes this property so special is it's unique plantation style layout with only four rooms or suites per villa. For privacy, each villa has its own swimming pool and each accommodation has its own private entrance and terrace... Guests may reserve anything from a single superior or deluxe room or a generous sized suite or an entire 3 - 5 bedroom villa. Due to the way this resort in St Martin is situated on the property that is perpendicular to the beach there is limited availability in the two ocean front villas that include the Presidential Suites and deluxe oceanfront rooms. All superior and deluxe rooms include kitchenettes. Suites offer full kitchens and large living rooms. Guests enjoy the peaceful surroundings and a cordial, pampering yet unobtrusive on-site multi-lingual staff prepared to assist with any special needs. Esmeralda offers free use of beach chairs & umbrellas. Each accommodation has a fully equipped kitchenette (suites have fully equipped kitchens including dishwasher), large tile bath with hair dryer plus a 110 outlet for shavers only, color satellite TV, room safe, air conditioning with ceiling fan, daily maid service. All bedrooms have Color TV by satellite (8 channels and video system), telephone, private safe, A/C, ceiling fan, private, furnished terrace, kitchenette with micro wave, electric coffee pot, refrigerator and dishes. SUPERIOR, DELUXE AND OCEANFRONT ROOMS: King or two double beds, kitchenette. Maximum occupancy: 2 people. Superior rooms have garden view and are generally located further from the beach. Deluxe rooms are a bit larger located nearer the pool. Oceanfront rooms are located nearest the beach. SUPERIOR SUITES: Spacious living room and bedroom area with king size four poster bed and full size pull-out sofa bed plus a fully equipped kitchen. Maximum occupancy: 2 adults & 2 children. PRESIDENTIAL SUITES: Large dining and living room area with full size sofa bed, separate master bedroom with king size colonial bed, TV in living room and master bedroom, 1 1/2 baths, radio/cassette/CD player and fully equipped kitchen. Suite is oceanfront. Maximum occupancy: 4 people.
